doc.repnme: Snapshot : financial inclusion in Tunisia - low-income households and micro-enterprises
doc.abstracts: This technical note provides a snapshot of financial inclusion trends and challenges in Tunisia. It follows the recent expiration of the Coordinated Vision for the Development of Microfinance in Tunisia 2011-2014, a national strategy published in 2011. Financial inclusion refers to a state where all the citizens and businesses have access to financial services corresponding to their needs. This document focuses on low-income populations and micro-enterprises and is a critical enabler of economic growth in Tunisia through spurring household economic activity, reducing household vulnerabilities, generating employment, and contributing to financial stability.
